title: Software Engineer - Cloud Ops [IC3]
description:
ALL SOURCEGRAPH ROLES ARE FULLY REMOTE

Who we are

Our mission at Sourcegraph is to make it so that everyone can code, not just ~0.1% of the population. Our code graph powers Cody, the most powerful and accurate AI coding assistant, as well as our Code Search product, which helps devs explore their entire codebase and make large-scale migrations and security fixes. We‚Äôre building software that builds software, and in doing so we‚Äôre making devs more productive and preparing for a world where a lot more code gets written.

It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Sourcegraph. AI has taken over the world, and we‚Äôve spent the last 10 years building infrastructure that‚Äôs integral to making AI generated code more powerful and accurate. Our customers include 4/5 FAANG companies, 4 of the top 10 banks, government organizations, Uber, Plaid, and many other companies building the software that pushes the world forward. We‚Äôve raised $225M at a $2.625B valuation from a16z, Sequoia, Redpoint, Craft and others. We‚Äôre making ambitious bets on our future and we‚Äôre looking to hire exceptional people to join our team as we make Sourcegraph one of the biggest and most influential companies in the world.

Location

üåé While we are an all-remote company and hire almost anywhere in the world, we have a preference for someone to reside in the following locations for this role. However, if you feel qualified, we welcome you to apply regardless of location. No matter what, working hours must overlap with EST for at least 20 hours/week.

Preferred locations:

  • Remote, EST Timezone

Why this job is exciting

Source code is at the heart of Sourcegraph. We support multiple code hosts and retrieve, store, index, and serve source code - to end users, admins, and other internal services. Our latest addition to our product catalog, Cody, reimagines how code is written and supercharges our developer customers. Sourcegraph hosts the infrastructure for our customers to manage their source code (search, insights, own, etc.) and our brand new AI Code Assistant (Cody).

This role gives you the opportunity to solve complex, challenging, and highly technical problems for our customers, both internally and externally, help unleash the potential and productivity of our Engineering teams, and delight our customers with industry-leading quality software. 

The Cloud Operation team primarily focuses on building a fully managed platform for using Sourcegraph, Sourcegraph Cloud, our SaaS offering. As a member of the Cloud Ops team, you will work closely with both external customers and internal stakeholders to meet their needs. You will:

  • Develop inter-cloud connectivity solutions to support enterprise customers from highly regulated industries to use Sourcegraph Cloud.
  • Build a control plane to orchestrate a fleet of single-tenant Sourcegraph Cloud instances. 
  • Expose complex infrastructure as API to support internal customers to iterate faster.
  • Dive into upstream dependencies (e.g., CDK for Terraform, Terraform providers for GCP)  to debug and patch non-trivial problems.
  • Be an advocate for building reliable services and work with leadership to help product teams achieve operational excellence. 
  • Participate in on-call rotation to uphold our contractual SLA commitments.

üìÖ Within one month, you will‚Ä¶

  • Onboard onto the Sourcegraph architecture, tooling, and development workflow.
  • Build a solid understanding of the team‚Äôs areas of ownership, technical challenges, and problems the team solves for our customers, and know how all of these align with the top-level company goals.
  • Actively participate in team meetings, sharing ideas and insights to contribute to the overall team goals.
  • Start contributing to the team goals and deliverables by shipping new features, debugging issues, and fixing bugs.

üìÖ Within three months, you will‚Ä¶

  • Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of the Cloud infrastructure, its underlying technologies, and its integration within the Sourcegraph ecosystem.
  • Lead initiatives contributing to team goals through both discovery and delivery phases, collaborating directly with product and design partners, other engineering teams, and non-technical stakeholders from different departments.
  • Contribute to the architectural design and implementation of new features or improvements, actively shaping the future direction of Cloud infrastructure based on customer needs.
  • Lead initiatives contributing to team goals on the roadmap by going through the entire product development lifecycle discovery, design, implementation, and delivery.
  • Participate in our on-call rotation.

üìÖ Within six months, you will‚Ä¶

  • Be defining long-term technical vision and strategies for new product development, scaling existing services, and managing technical debt. These plans will consist of multiple smaller milestones, which you will deliver with the team iteratively.
  • Collaborate with the Engineering Manager on defining the team‚Äôs growth strategy based on the long-term product vision, the technical vision, and the team‚Äôs needs.
  • Seek feedback from customers and stakeholders to identify opportunities for further improvements or new features, actively iterating on the Cloud infrastructure to ensure it continues to meet our high bar.

About you

You bring a product mindset in balancing architectural flexibility and philosophy with meeting immediate customer demand. You are an experienced software engineer who looks to solve problems through writing code rather than one-off operations. You are passionate about user experience and self-service. You balance maintaining and designing high-impact systems with a pragmatic understanding of how to make appropriate tradeoffs (e.g., cut scope, low-tech vs. custom complex solutions) to ship quickly and iterate when necessary. 

Qualifications:

  • Proficiency in Go, or other strongly typed languages.
  • Knowledge in one of the public cloud platform providers (GCP, AWS, Azure)
  • Experience with Terraform (or similar IaC solutions) and Kubernetes to build tooling and automation.
  • Skilled at debugging distributed systems followed by designing and implementing solutions to those problems. This means you should know your way around various OS-level primitives, e.g., network, CPU, and memory.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and empathetically, especially in writing and documentation.
  • Preferred time zone between UTC-8 and UTC+2

Nice to haves:

  • Built services and exposed them as API for external consumption  (e.g., gRPC).
  • Comfortable implementing system-level software  (e.g., custom transport protocol) if needed or has contributed to Kubernetes controllers/operators.
  • Published blog posts and/or tech talks about your work.
  • Experience working on small high-performing teams, preferably tech startups.

Level

üìä This job is an IC3. You can read more about our job leveling philosophy in our Handbook.

Compensation

üí∏ We pay you an above-average salary because we want to hire the best people who are fully focused on helping Sourcegraph succeed, not worried about paying bills. As an open and transparent company that values competitive compensation, our compensation ranges are visible to every single Sourcegraph teammate.

To determine your salary, we use a number of market and data-driven salary sources, along with your location zone, and target the high-end of the range to ensure we‚Äôre always paying above market regardless of where you live in the world. Both U.S. and international locations are divided into one of four zones, determined by the cost of labor index for each area. The starting salary for a successful candidate will be based on level, job-related skills, experience, qualifications, and location zone. Please note that these salary ranges may be adjusted in the future.

üí∞The target compensation for this role is $136,000 USD base.

  • Zone 2: $136,000 USD
  • Zone 3: $102,000 USD
  • Zone 4: $68,000 USD

Please speak with a recruiter for additional information regarding zone locations.

üìà In addition to our cash compensation, we offer equity (because when we succeed as a company, we want you to succeed, too) and generous perks & benefits.

Interview process

Below is the interview process you can expect for this role (you can read more about the types of interviews in our Handbook). It may look like a lot of steps, but rest assured that we move quickly and the steps are designed to help you get the information needed to determine if we‚Äôre the right fit for you‚Ä¶ Interviewing is a two-way street, after all! 

We expect the interview process to take 5.5 hours in total.

üëã Introduction Stage - we have initial conversations to get to know you better‚Ä¶

  • [30m] Recruiter Screen
  • [15m] Hiring Manager Intro

üßë‚Äçüíª Team Interview Stage - we then delve into your experience in more depth and introduce you to members of the team, including cross-functional partners‚Ä¶

  • [Async] Take home exercise
  • [60m] Exercise walkthrough (10-15m) & System Design (45m)
  • [60m] Pairing Exercise (45m) & Infrastructure Interview (15m)
  • [45m] Cross-functional Team Collaboration Interview
  • [60m] Resume Deep Dive

üéâ Final Interview Stage - we move you to our final round, where you gain a better understanding of our business and values holistically‚Ä¶

  • [30m] Values
  • [30m] Leadership with co-founder 
  • We check references and conduct your background check

Please note - you are welcome to request additional conversations with anyone you would like to meet, but didn‚Äôt get to meet during the interview process.

Not sure if this is you?

We want a diverse, global team, with a broad range of experience and perspectives. If this job sounds great, but you‚Äôre not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every application, and will either move forward with you, find another team that might be a better fit, keep in touch for future opportunities, or thank you for your time.

Learn more about us

To create a product that serves the needs of all developers, we are building a diverse all-remote team that is distributed across the world. Sourcegraph is an equal opportunity workplace; we welcome people from all backgrounds and communities. 

We provide competitive compensation and practical benefits to keep you happy and healthy so that you can do your best work.  

Learn more about what it is like to work at Sourcegraph by reading our handbook.

We want to ensure Sourcegraph is an environment that suits your working style and empowers you to do your best work, so we are eager to answer any questions that you have about us at any point in the interview process.

Go back to the careers page for all open positions.

 

Sourcegraph participates in E-Verify for U.S. Employees

title: Product Design Trainee
description:
üßò What we offer:

We offer a 2-year fixed-term contract with an opportunity to join our team full-time if it works for both parties.

You will receive salary and equity compensation, health insurance, a laptop, a minimum of four weeks of yearly vacation, a personal development budget, and other benefits and perks.

We operate in a fully remote work environment ‚Äì work from anywhere globally. 

We have at least two annual team gatherings. The previous gatherings were in Ljubljana, San Francisco, Mexico, Bali, and Siglufj√∂r√∞ur.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!
As the Product Design Trainee at SafetyWing,
you will assist in designing and developing our products. Your contributions will support creating exceptional designs and adding depth and meaning to our projects while upholding our core values.

We are on a mission to remove the role of geographical borders as a barrier to equal opportunities and freedom for everyone. And we are doing that by creating simple health, insurance, and retirement products for remote workers worldwide as a replacement for national welfare systems.

üë®‚Äçüé§¬†As our Product Design Trainee, you will:

  • Support product design initiatives from initial concept to final execution, ensuring all deliverables meet quality standards and timelines.
  • Contribute to process improvements by helping implement and advocate for ongoing enhancements in design processes and developing strategies to elevate the quality and efficiency of design outputs.
  • Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and other designers to maintain a cohesive and consistent design language across all products.
  • Adhere to design systems by assisting in evolving and enforcing SafetyWing's design system, ensuring all design elements are aligned with established guidelines.
  • Present design ideas by helping communicate and present product design concepts to cross-functional teams and senior leadership, fostering a collaborative and informed decision-making process.

üß™ We are looking for someone who:

  • Has a passion for product design and a strong desire to learn and grow in the field.
  • Holds a relevant degree and some practical experience or internship in product design.
  • Has a portfolio showcasing design projects and practical experience.
  • Is proficient in using design and prototyping tools such as Figma and committed to continuously learning new features.
  • Can communicate design ideas clearly and champion design principles across diverse audiences, including design and non-design stakeholders.
  • Is comfortable with ambiguity.
  • Has a strong sense of empathy for both users and team members.
  • Is interested in helping build a global social safety net.
  • Thinks for themselves instead of copying others.
  • Is creative and bold in the face of any problem.
  • Is intellectually honest and has high integrity.

title: Product Marketing Trainee
description:
üßò What we offer

  • Fully remote work environment ‚Äì work from anywhere globally. 
  • Competitive compensation.
  • Global coverage with Remote Health and Nomad Insurance.
  • A minimum of 20 days of compensated time off each year.
  • Referral bonus - an incentive program rewarding you for helping us find exceptional talent to join our team.
  • Opportunity to unlock more benefits as your tenure with SafetyWing grows.
We are looking forward to hearing from you!
 SafetyWing (YC W18) is seeking a Product Marketing Trainee to assist in streamlining our marketing strategies and enhancing the success of our insurance products. In this role, you will dive into market research, craft compelling messaging, oversee product launches, and develop tools to boost customer acquisition and retention. Your efforts will ensure our audience understands and values our products, directly contributing to our growth.

We are on a mission to remove the role of geographical borders as a barrier to equal opportunities and freedom for everyone. We are doing that by creating simple health, insurance, and retirement products for remote workers worldwide as a replacement for national welfare systems.

üíª Your responsibilities will include

  • Talking to our customers to find out why they buy our products and keeping an eye on market trends.
  • Crafting clear and engaging messages that resonate with our diverse audience.
  • Tracking and refining our growth, making data-driven suggestions for enhancements.
  • Ensuring that both our team and customers have a deep understanding and appreciation of our product.
  • Managing our website in collaboration with the design team to ensure it reflects our core messaging.
  • Coordinating the launch of new features and product updates, prioritizing alignment with our product's core principles.
  • Creating web pages and ads to attract and keep customers, always seeking ways to do it better.
  • Collaborating with customer success to proactively tackle customer issues and refine their experience.

üß™ We are looking for someone who

  • Has a background in product marketing, with some practical experience or internship.
  • Is passionate about creating strategies that resonate with target audiences.
  • Is a team player who's eager to collaborate across functions to achieve shared goals.
  • Is an innovative thinker, always looking for new ways to engage customers and improve their experience with our products.
  • Has a strong ability to communicate complex ideas simply and attractively.
  • Is driven by data to make decisions and improve product positioning.
üòÄ We like to work with people who:
  • Want to help build a global social safety net.
  • Think for themselves instead of copying others.
  • Are willing to try new things, even with the risk of failure.
  • Are intellectually curious and open to new ideas.
  • Are creative and bold in the face of any problems.
  • Have strong integrity and do the right thing.

title: Account Executive
Content Marketing Manager, Content Amplification
Associate Opener/Sales Development Representative
description:
üßò What we offer

  • Fully remote work environment ‚Äì work from anywhere globally. 
  • Competitive compensation: base and commission.
  • Global coverage with Remote Health and Nomad Insurance.
  • A minimum of 20 days of compensated time off each year.
  • Referral bonus - an incentive program rewarding you for helping us find exceptional talent to join our team.
  • Opportunity to unlock more benefits as your tenure with SafetyWing grows.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!
We‚Äôre seeking a friendly and energetic Associate Opener to join our Direct Sales Team and help us connect with amazing customers! Your talent in pinpointing potential leads will steer SafetyWing toward achieving our goals.

We are building a global social safety net, including health and retirement for remote workers worldwide, as a replacement for national welfare systems. If we succeed, we believe this will help ensure freedom and equal opportunity for everyone, and it is one of the more important tasks of our time that no one else is working on.

üíª Your responsibilities will include

  • Create awareness and generate interest for Remote Health by SafetyWing among companies.
  • Discover impactful leads.
  • Conduct outreach through calling, emailing, and social media to engage potential clients.
  • Set up qualified meetings between target buyers and our account executives (Closers).
  • Assist in whipping up and executing lead-generation campaigns.
  • Meticulously enter and manage sales data, ensuring accuracy and reliability in our CRM.

üß™ We are looking for someone who:

  • Has an exceptional knack for research ‚Äì we value this highly!
  • Has successful experience in proactive customer outreach.
  • Has excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and written.
  • Is tech-savvy and comfortable with Google Workspace, CRM software, and marketing automation tools.
  • Is a continual learner, detailed, planning pro, and autonomous worker.
  • Extra shine if you have experience in lead generation and a diploma or degree in marketing, business, or a related field.
üòÄ We like to work with people who:
  • Want to help build a global social safety net on the Internet.
  • Think for themselves instead of copying others.
  • Are willing to try new things, even with the risk of failure.
  • Are intellectually curious and open to new ideas.
  • Are creative and bold in the face of any problems.
  • Have strong integrity and do the right thing.

title: People Success Partner (Europe)
description:
About Airalo
Alo! Airalo is the world‚Äôs first eSIM store that helps people connect in over 200+ countries and regions across the globe. We are building the next digital service that revolutionizes the telecom industry. We are a travel-tech company and an equal-opportunity environment that values and executes diversity, inclusion, and equity. Our team is spread across 50+ countries and six continents. What glues us together is our commitment to changing the way you connect.

About you
We hope that you care deeply about the quality of your work, the intrinsic worth of tasks, and the success of your team. You are self-disciplined and do not require micromanagement in terms of your skillset and work ethic. You do your best to flourish as an individual every day while working hard to foster a collaborative team environment. You believe in the importance of being ‚Äî and staying ‚Äî authentic, honest, positive, and kind. You are a good interlocutor with clear and concise communication. You are able to manage multiple projects, have an analytical mind, pay keen attention to detail, and love to get your hands dirty. You are cognizant, tolerant, and welcoming of vulnerabilities and cultural differences.

About the Role
Position: Full-time / Employee
Location: Remote-first
Benefits: Health Insurance, work-from-anywhere stipend, annual wellness & learning credits, annual all-expenses-paid company retreat in a gorgeous destination & other benefits

As a People Success Partner, you will be responsible for partnering with our Leadership team and ensuring all day-to-day People matters are handled. You‚Äôll be working closely with our founders, C-level executives, VPs & Directors of your assigned tribe, as well as the entire People & Talent team.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Assists Management in the development of solutions for current and future business needs through employee development, organizational development, cultural and process-oriented perspectives
  • Be knowledgeable and considerate of the complexity of supporting a fully remote team, across almost 60 countries
  • Support with yearly Headcount Planning & Forecasts with the People Director, Talent, and Hiring Managers
  • Serve as a trusted advisor to team members, addressing concerns, resolving conflicts, and promoting a positive workplace culture
  • Ensures all areas of that team are running smoothly and that leadership in their teams feel supported
  • Handles all performance-related challenges, and supports their teams to be high-performing, engaged, and successful
  • Has strong rapport-building skills to become a trusted partner to your key stakeholders
  • Support leaders in ensuring People's KPIs are met, such as regular Performance Reviews, Compensation Reviews, etc.
    • ,

    Must-haves:

  • Proven experience in business partnering, with multiple stakeholders, across different countries
  • Possesses strong leadership skills and is resilience
  • Possesses strong customer-centric skills with a passion for service, ensuring all our interactions with people are handled professionally and with thorough attention to detail
  • Proven experience in strategic People Experience plans and solutions, dealing with organization strategies and complex business/People-related topics;
  • Strong stakeholder management, interpersonal, and communication skills with all levels of seniority in a cross-functional & global environment
  • Effective & analytical mindset, creative and pragmatic problem-solving skills with strong business acumen & user-centric philosophy;
  • Self-driven, optimistic, and keen to work as part of a professional and closely-knit team while highly organized with excellent time management skills
  • Champion diversity and inclusion efforts, promoting a culture of respect and belonging
    • ,

    Good to have:

  • Experience in the travel tech and/or telco industry;
  • Relevant HR certifications (iHRP, CIPD, SHRM, etc);
  • Additional written/spoken languages.
    • We sincerely thank all applicants in advance for submitting their interest in this opportunity with Airalo.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Airalo
Alo! Airalo is the world‚Äôs first eSIM store that helps people connect in over 200+ countries and regions across the globe. We are building the next digital service that revolutionizes the telecom industry. We are a travel-tech company and an equal-opportunity environment that values and executes diversity, inclusion, and equity. Our team is spread across 50+ countries and six continents. What glues us together is our commitment to changing the way you connect.

About you
We hope that you care deeply about the quality of your work, the intrinsic worth of tasks, and the success of your team. You are self-disciplined and do not require micromanagement in terms of your skillset and work ethic. You do your best to flourish as an individual every day while working hard to foster a collaborative team environment. You believe in the importance of being ‚Äî and staying ‚Äî authentic, honest, positive, and kind. You are a good interlocutor with clear and concise communication. You are able to manage multiple projects, have an analytical mind, pay keen attention to detail, and love to get your hands dirty. You are cognizant, tolerant, and welcoming of vulnerabilities and cultural differences.

About the Role
Position: Full-time / Employee
Location: Remote-first
Benefits: Health Insurance, work-from-anywhere stipend, annual wellness & learning credits, annual all-expenses-paid company retreat in a gorgeous destination & other benefits

As a Data Analyst, you have strong analytical and technical skills and are comfortable collaborating with various departments including Product, Engineering, Design, Growth, Finance, and Partnerships. You will provide actionable insights to drive decision-making and help shape the Airalo strategy and roadmaps across departments. You will play a key role in further growing our Data Analytics function and help us define best practices to improve our ways of working. You‚Äôll be the go-to person in the team to run ad-hoc analyses, find root causes of problems, and evaluate business impact.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Collaborate with multiple departments to understand their data analysis needs and provide strategic insights to support decision-making, define strategy and prioritize roadmaps
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for ad-hoc analyses, root cause analysis, and evaluation of business impact across the company
  • Partner with Product, Engineering, and Design to define tracking, AB testing strategy, and measure post-launch feature and product impact
  • Develop data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision-making across departments
  • Convey insights through both reports and visual presentations.
  • Create documentation associated with the dashboards highlighting definitions, event schema, data models, analyses
  • Gather and cleanse data from primary and secondary sources
    • ,

    Must-haves:

  • 4+ years of experience in a hands-on analytics role
  • Strong ability to synthesize data into actionable insights
  • Strong SQL proficiency and understanding of data modeling concepts
  • Experience with using data visualization tools and analytics tools
  • A clear understanding of A/B testing methodologies
  • Demonstrate curiosity and data fluency
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) in mathematics, computer science, economics, or statistics
    • ,

    Good to haves:

  • Experience using QuickSight, CleverTap, Hotjar, Google Analytics
  • Experience with consumer and SaaS products
  • Prior work experience in telecommunications
  • Knowledge of eSIM and GSMA-related technologies and services
    • If you are interested in this position, please apply via the link.

    We sincerely thank all applicants in advance for submitting their interest in this opportunity with Airalo.

title: Senior Product Manager, Graphing
description:
At BioRender, our mission is to accelerate the world‚Äôs ability to learn, discover and communicate science. We are passionate about democratizing science communication in order to accelerate scientific discovery and understanding. We're looking for amazing people to help create the world‚Äôs go-to-place and platform where science is communicated. Come join us!

You can think of BioRender as the ‚ÄúFigma or Canva for scientists,‚Äù with a suite of web-based graphics communication products that empower scientists to create beautiful scientific visuals and presentations with ease.

The Graphing team‚Äôs mission is to expand what scientists are able to communicate in BioRender through the easiest-to-use and most delightful graphing and statistical analysis solution. Graphing is a new product currently in open beta, and we‚Äôre looking for a Product Manager to lead the strategic direction for the product that helps scientists analyze, visualize and present data to achieve product market fit. This is an exciting opportunity for a product builder who loves the strategic questions that come from scaling a product from 0-1, to 1-N!

What you'll do at BioRender:

  • Within the first 90 days, become an expert on our users, their usage behaviors and workflows, and the market landscape. Understanding the user, the market, and our product offering will be critical to your success
  • Own the strategy for the Graphing product and how it integrates with the rest of the BioRender product suite.
  • Talk to users and obsess over user feedback and usage data of beta users to build the right feature set that will create raving fans.
  • Collaborate with Design and Data Science to determine what will make BioRender Graphing a critical part of industry scientists‚Äô software stack.
  • Partner with marketing on the go to market strategy for the product, determining how best to spread awareness for the product to grow usage
  • Drive new feature development to grow user engagement KPIs 
  • Launch experiments to reduce barriers to entry into the product and increase our funnel conversion rate for new and returning users
  • Contribute to the product strategy of BioRender. As we move from a single product company to a multiple product company, the Graphing PM will be integral to formulating our overall product expansion strategy. 
    • ,

    Our Ideal Fit:

  • 4+ years of product management experience
  • Proven track record of launching 0-1 products and achieving product-market fit in a market with incumbent players 
  • You‚Äôve owned the end-to-end user experience for an entire product. You have experience developing, launching and iterating a highly ambiguous and broad product surface area that may take multiple months to get adoption.
  • You have clear examples of transforming ambiguous user problems into clear roadmaps, and can draw on stories where you had to make a call between two divergent paths
  • You have experience using user quantitative (e.g., metrics, analytics) and qualitative insights (e.g., research, user feedback) to inform product prioritization and decision-making
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences
  • You are detail oriented and user obsessed
    • ,

    Nice to haves:

  • Background in statistics or data science is a plus. At least, statistics or math is exciting to you. You will not need to be an expert in statistics and will partner with a data scientist, but statistics is a core part of the product and user research, so you will need to be comfortable with learning about users‚Äô
  • Educational background in life sciences

    • Note: We recognize that career paths vary, and your unique journey may have equipped you with the necessary skills even if you don‚Äôt meet all of the criteria above. If you believe you have what it takes to excel in this role, we encourage you to apply!
    Check out our candidate resource - Engineering, Product & Design at BioRender! 
    You can also read more about the BioRender interview process and FAQs here!

    Check out what it's like to work at BioRender in Canada and the US!

    #LI-KS1

title: Social Media & Influencer Marketing Specialist (Singapore)
description:
About Airalo
Alo! Airalo is the world‚Äôs first eSIM store that helps people connect in over 200+ countries and regions across the globe. We are building the next digital service that revolutionizes the telecom industry. We are a travel-tech company and an equal-opportunity environment that values and executes diversity, inclusion, and equity. Our team is spread across 50+ countries and six continents. What glues us together is our commitment to changing the way you connect.

About you
We hope that you care deeply about the quality of your work, the intrinsic worth of tasks, and the success of your team. You are self-disciplined and do not require micromanagement in terms of your skillset and work ethic. You do your best to flourish as an individual every day while working hard to foster a collaborative team environment. You believe in the importance of being ‚Äî and staying ‚Äî authentic, honest, positive, and kind. You are a good interlocutor with clear and concise communication. You are able to manage multiple projects, have an analytical mind, pay keen attention to detail, and love to get your hands dirty. You are cognizant, tolerant, and welcoming of vulnerabilities and cultural differences.

About the Role
Position: Full-time / Employee
Location: Remote-first
Benefits: Health Insurance, work-from-anywhere stipend, annual wellness & learning credits, annual all-expenses-paid company retreat in a gorgeous destination & other benefits

Airalo is seeking a talented and highly motivated Social Media and Influencer Marketing Specialist to join our APAC marketing team and grow the Singapore market.
You will be responsible for guiding the strategy and development of our entire social media ecosystem in your market and you will develop and execute influencer marketing campaigns to raise brand awareness, drive user engagement and boost conversions.
This role offers an exciting opportunity to work with some of the most influential voices in the travel and tech industry.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Strategy Development and Campaign Planning: Brainstorm, develop and execute end-to-end influencer marketing campaigns aligned with Airalo's goals and target audience.
  • Identify and Recruit Influencers: Partner with relevant Singapore influencers, content creators and/or agencies to create authentic and engaging content that showcases Airalo's products.
  • Social Media Strategy: Develop and execute an effective social media strategy tailored to the Singaporean market to increase brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation.
  • Community Engagement: Monitor and actively engage with the Airalo community on social media platforms, respond to comments, questions, and feedback promptly, and build positive relationships with followers.
  • Performance Analysis and Reporting: Monitor, analyze performance and prepare reports on the ROI and effectiveness of influencer marketing efforts, including KPIs and metrics
  • Budget Management: Effectively manage the budget allocated for influencer marketing campaigns, ensuring efficient use of resources.
  • Compliance and Contracts: Ensure that influencer partnerships comply with legal regulations and company policies. Manage influencer contracts and negotiations.
  • Crisis Management: Handle potential social media crises effectively, maintain a positive brand image, and address customer concerns professionally
  • Stay Up-to-Date: Stay informed about industry trends, emerging influencers, and new platforms to continuously adapt and enhance Airalo's influencer marketing strategies.
    • ,

    Must-haves:

  • At least 3+ years of experience in a Social Media and Influencer Marketing role, preferably in a startup/scale up context
  • Strong knowledge of the Singapore market
  • General marketing experience in brand management, content, social media, influencer and market insights with an in-depth understanding of the social media and digital space
  • Excellent knowledge of the main social media platforms (with focus on Instagram, TikTok and Youtube) and any key platform used or emerging in your target market; abreast of social media best practices, and regional, and global trends
  • Superior internal/external communication & cross-functional stakeholder management skills
  • Enjoying and excelling at handling multiple projects simultaneously in a complex environment
  • Good time management with an eye for perfection
  • Fluent English communication skills

  • A network of Singapore influencers or influencers agencies you already worked with

title: Social Media & Influencer Marketing Specialist (Australia)
description:
About Airalo
Alo! Airalo is the world‚Äôs first eSIM store that helps people connect in over 200+ countries and regions across the globe. We are building the next digital service that revolutionizes the telecom industry. We are a travel-tech company and an equal-opportunity environment that values and executes diversity, inclusion, and equity. Our team is spread across 50+ countries and six continents. What glues us together is our commitment to changing the way you connect.

About you
We hope that you care deeply about the quality of your work, the intrinsic worth of tasks, and the success of your team. You are self-disciplined and do not require micromanagement in terms of your skillset and work ethic. You do your best to flourish as an individual every day while working hard to foster a collaborative team environment. You believe in the importance of being ‚Äî and staying ‚Äî authentic, honest, positive, and kind. You are a good interlocutor with clear and concise communication. You are able to manage multiple projects, have an analytical mind, pay keen attention to detail, and love to get your hands dirty. You are cognizant, tolerant, and welcoming of vulnerabilities and cultural differences.

About the Role
Position: Full-time / Employee
Location: Remote-first
Benefits: Health Insurance, work-from-anywhere stipend, annual wellness & learning credits, annual all-expenses-paid company retreat in a gorgeous destination & other benefits

Airalo is seeking a talented and highly motivated Social Media and Influencer Marketing Specialist to join our APAC team and grow the Australian market.
You will be responsible for guiding the strategy and development of our entire social media ecosystem in your market and you will develop and execute influencer marketing campaigns to raise brand awareness, drive user engagement and boost conversions.
This role offers an exciting opportunity to work with some of the most influential voices in the travel and tech industry.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Strategy Development and Campaign Planning: Brainstorm, develop and execute end-to-end influencer marketing campaigns aligned with Airalo's goals and target audience.
  • Identify and Recruit Influencers: Partner with relevant Australian influencers, content creators and/or agencies to create authentic and engaging content that showcases Airalo's products.
  • Social Media Strategy: Develop and execute an effective social media strategy tailored to the Australian market to increase brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation.
  • Community Engagement: Monitor and actively engage with the Airalo community on social media platforms, respond to comments, questions, and feedback promptly, and build positive relationships with followers.
  • Performance Analysis and Reporting: Monitor, analyze performance and prepare reports on the ROI and effectiveness of influencer marketing efforts, including KPIs and metrics
  • Budget Management: Effectively manage the budget allocated for influencer marketing campaigns, ensuring efficient use of resources.
  • Compliance and Contracts: Ensure that influencer partnerships comply with legal regulations and company policies. Manage influencer contracts and negotiations.
  • Crisis Management: Handle potential social media crises effectively, maintain a positive brand image, and address customer concerns professionally
  • Stay Up-to-Date: Stay informed about industry trends, emerging influencers, and new platforms to continuously adapt and enhance Airalo's influencer marketing strategies.

  • Excellent knowledge of the main social media platforms (with focus on Instagram, TikTok and Youtube) and any key platform used or emerging in your target market; abreast of social media best practices, and regional, and global trends

title: Customer Success Manager (Remote)
description:
About Pluto

Pluto is the Enterprise Spend Management platform for MENA serving the $30 Trillion+ B2B Payments market. Pluto has been awarded the "Corporate solutions of the year" by the Middle Eastern Fintech Association.

Pluto is backed by some of Silicon Valley‚Äôs top-tier venture capital firms. We‚Äôve raised $7M Seed from top investors and operators, including founders from Ramp, Airbase, Plaid, Italic & Senior Leadership at Shopify, Cash App, Checkout.com, Alloy and some of the worlds most successful FinTech VCs like GFC, Graph Ventures, Soma Capital, Adapt Ventures, amongst others who‚Äôve trusted us ü§©

With the vision of building a modern financial operating system for businesses in MENA, we‚Äôre at the tipping point of a fintech revolution. We‚Äôre a lean but impactful team that dreams big and believes in making the impossible happen - and we are looking for someone equally motivated who wants to make their mark and help us expand our horizons.

About this role

We are hiring for an experienced Account Manager. You will be responsible for managing ensuring that Pluto's current clients continuously increase in usage and be the front facing lead to increase adoption of our platfor. You will work directly with the COO and set the bar for what excellent account management looks like.

Pluto is growing rapidly, with over 600+ businesses using Pluto in the UAE, including some of the largest enterprise customers with over 1000 employees regularly using Pluto. When a client purchases Pluto, they must go through change management‚Äîboth at the finance team level and at the broader company-wide adoption level.

You will be responsible for the change management process, onboarding, implementation, and success of Pluto‚Äôs clients.

Your KPIs will be driven by the fastest time to successfully implement Pluto across the company and positive Net Revenue Retention.

How this role within Pluto

You will be joining as a founding core team member of Pluto‚Äôs account management practice. This role will be responsible for ensuring positive net revenue retention across all of Pluto‚Äôs customers including free, pro & essential tier customers.

Our engineering and product teams ship products at a lightning-fast cadence. It will be your responsibility to ensure the most successful enterprises in MENA adopt Pluto for finance control and compliance across their companies.

Your responsibilities:

  1. Be the directly responsible individual (engagement manager) for Pluto‚Äôs clients.
  2. Be the go-to relationship manager for our clients.
  3. Ensure positive net revenue retention through upselling and driving adoption across the organization.
  4. Carry out training and onboarding sessions for customers and their employees as needed.
  5. Drive revenue by owning renewals, use case expansions, and overall growth via continuous engagement, emails, webinars, and other channels.
  6. Be the subject matter expert for prospects during pre-sales calls and meetings.
  7. Collaborate with product, design, and engineering teams during client engagements to carry out implementations of feature requests and custom integrations.
  8. Surface thematic product gaps and needs within your book of business.

Requirements:

You are a good fit if..

  1. You have previously been in similar roles for at least 3+ years within B2B SaaS software
  2. You can go deep into understanding complex products and have the ability to effectively communicate value to customers
  3. You have the ability to take a systematic, process driven approach to activating and retaining clients
  4. You have a proven ability to build and maintain relationships with customers
  5. You are confident and don‚Äôt shy away from negotiations or upsells with Finance Leaders (VPs, Directors) and Controllers
  6. You have the ability to work cross functionality with engineering & product, and communicate your requirements in a way that is easily understood
  7. You are on top of your inbox, have time management skills and leverage modern tools to ensure you are effective
  8. You understand that startups require to fill many roles and maintain high energy all throughout üí™üèΩüí™üèΩüí™üèΩ
  9. Demonstrated pipeline maintenance skills (Farming) using Sales tools such as Hubspot, Salesloft etc.

Optional, but great to have:

  1. Basic understanding of accounting and finance ecosystem
  2. Experience utilizing common tools within the CS tech stack (Hubspot etc.)

Benefits:

Benefits

  • Hybrid and flexible work culture
  • Competitive Base Pay
  • Commissions & bonuses on upsells and positive net revenue retention

title: Compliance Operations Analyst (KYB, AML, KYC)
description:
About Pluto

Pluto is the Enterprise Spend Management platform for MENA serving the $30 Trillion+ B2B Payments market. Pluto has been awarded the "Corporate solutions of the year" by the Middle Eastern Fintech Association.

Pluto is backed by some of Silicon Valley‚Äôs top-tier venture capital firms. We‚Äôve raised $7M Seed from top investors and operators, including founders from Ramp, Airbase, Plaid, Italic & Senior Leadership at Shopify, Cash App, Checkout.com, Alloy and some of the worlds most successful FinTech VCs like GFC, Graph Ventures, Soma Capital, Adapt Ventures, amongst others who‚Äôve trusted us ü§©

With the vision of building a modern financial operating system for businesses in MENA, we‚Äôre at the tipping point of a fintech revolution. We‚Äôre a lean but impactful team that dreams big and believes in making the impossible happen - and we are looking for someone equally motivated who wants to make their mark and help us expand our horizons.

About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Compliance Operations Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for Know Your Customer (KYC), Know Your Business (KYB), and Request for Information (RFI) management. This role is crucial in ensuring that Pluto meets regulatory requirements and maintains the highest standards of compliance.

Key Responsibilities:

  • KYC Management:
    • Conduct thorough due diligence and verification of customer identities.
    • Review and analyze customer information and documentation to ensure compliance with regulatory standards.
    • Monitor and assess the risk level of customers and take appropriate actions.
  • KYB Management:
    • Perform business verification processes for corporate clients.
    • Analyze business documentation, including registration details, financial statements, and beneficial ownership.
    • Ensure all business clients adhere to compliance policies and procedures.
  • RFI Management:
    • Handle requests for information from regulatory bodies and internal stakeholders.
    • Collect, organize, and present data in response to compliance-related inquiries.
    • Maintain accurate records of all RFI activities and ensure timely responses.
  • Compliance Monitoring and Reporting:
    • Prepare and submit reports on compliance onboarding activities and findings.
    • Assist in the development and implementation of compliance policies and procedures.
  • Customer Relationships
    • Develop a strong relationship with customers and promote quicker onboarding
    • Work closely with other departments to ensure a cohesive approach to compliance onboarding of customers
    • Provide training and support to customers for all compliance related matters
    • Work closely with account management teams to ensure healthy client relationship
    • Work closely with product and engineering teams to improve our processes continuously

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in a compliance role, preferably within the fintech or financial services industry.
  • Strong knowledge of KYC, KYB, and RFI processes and regulations.
  • Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in using compliance software and tools.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Benefits:

  • Remote Friendly Workplace
  • Frequent team off sites!
  • Bonuses on exceptional performance

title: Sr. Backend Software Engineer (Remote) - M√©xico
description:
EMPOWER OVERVIEW

Empower is a high-growth financial technology company on a mission to expand access to fair credit to give anyone in the world the opportunity to improve their financial security and mobility. We dream up and launch one-of-a-kind features that help our members get money instantly whenever they need it, save for the future, and rewrite their financial story. Our members see Empower Cash Advance as a life-saver, Empower Automatic Savings as a game-changer, and the new Empower Thrive line of credit as a lifeline to low-cost borrowing and the only practical path to building good credit.

Empower M√©xico is a new venture for the company. We offer small loans ranging from $150 to $2,000 MXN to help Mexican customers in a pinch, using non-traditional data to underwrite customers.

Empower is backed by Sequoia Capital, Blisce, and Icon Ventures. Are we the next great place to grow your impact and accelerate your career? We think so:

Inc. ranked Empower #56 in the 2023 Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in the US (#55 in 2022). Forbes put Empower on its 2023 list of America's Best Startup Employers. Fast Company recognized the new Empower Thrive line of credit in their 2022 list of the Next Big Things in Tech.

THE EMPOWER WAY
Great Expectations: We come up with bold, audacious goals for ourselves and go all out for impact
Owner Mindset: We give every employee latitude to act independently, make smart choices, and move the business forward
Spirited Debate: We love skeptics and seek counter opinions to challenge our personal assumptions and expand our view
Customer Obsession: We listen to understand, empathize, and create a memorable, rewarding experience for our community
Inclusive Collaboration: We believe diverse teams make the best decisions, and we strive to give diverse voices a seat at the table
No Jerks Allowed: We value our relationships and take the time to build trust and connection and communicate respectfully
 
 
WHAT EMPOWER OFFERS

Competitive salary
Generous equity package
Full healthcare and dental benefits
Technology  expense reimbursement
Work  from anywhere

JOB DESCRIPTION
As a Backend Server Software Engineer, you‚Äôll work on the engine that powers the Empower apps and business. You‚Äôll engage with a collaborative, high powered team to develop solutions and lead product engineering on projects with a reach of millions. The solutions you‚Äôll build will be robust, secure and easy to understand both for our users and your engineering peers. You‚Äôll take end to end ownership of new features and product lines shaping work in early stages, building, deploying and running post deployment analysis to ensure we‚Äôre hitting our goals.

Travel for company offsites is expected at a minimum 2 times a year.

Key Responsibilities

  • Designing, building, and deploying server application code that interfaces with 3rd party clients and Empower
  • Implementing secure coding standards in accordance with the Empower Secure Development Policy
  • Perform on-going security testing and code review to improve software security
  • Monitoring the performance of the Empower server application and applying corrective action through bug fixing and improved solutions
  • Minimizing defects and improving reliability through: Development of automated tests, manual test validation, development of fit for purpose architecture and code, contributing to PRs
  • Developing and maintaining the server app build and deployment pipeline
  • Collaborating cross-functionally to define, design and ship new features that create customer and business value
  • Working with business and operations stakeholders for the definition and development of business requirements
  • Contributing to server/client contract API definition
  • Architecting solutions that interface into 3rd parties and the Empower M√©xico Android app
  • Maximizing effective development and identifying new technology opportunities by: Keeping across .NET development announcements, being across community best practice, discovering and evaluating new technologies
  • Participating in the server ops on call schedule
    • ,

    Candidate Qualifications

  • Bachelor degree or greater within Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related subject
  • 3+ years developing web APIs within .NET (C#)
  • Working experience constructing and optimizing MicrosoftSQL queries using ORMs such as Entity Framework
    • ,

    Preferred Qualifications

  • Worked on a ‚Äúzero to one‚Äù project taking a business from an idea to a profitable venture
  • Experience scaling a solution from tens of thousands to millions of customers (Scaling databases, queues, caching, monitoring and security with Azure)
  • Contributed to and/or owned a large, complex, critical banking or lending solution
    • At Empower, we hire for people that push themselves to understand others and seek out ways to challenge their personal assumptions. Our hope is that by fostering such an environment, we strengthen our business and relationships by putting people first. We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workspace where everyone (regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics) feels like they belong. Even if your experience doesn‚Äôt exactly match up to our job description, you should feel empowered to apply regardless!

title: Senior Paid Search Specialist, User Experience
description:
About Airalo
Alo! Airalo is the world‚Äôs first eSIM store that helps people connect in over 200+ countries and regions across the globe. We are building the next digital service that revolutionizes the telecom industry. We are a travel-tech company and an equal-opportunity environment that values and executes diversity, inclusion, and equity. Our team is spread across 50+ countries and six continents. What glues us together is our commitment to changing the way you connect.

About you
We hope that you care deeply about the quality of your work, the intrinsic worth of tasks, and the success of your team. You are self-disciplined and do not require micromanagement in terms of your skillset and work ethic. You do your best to flourish as an individual every day while working hard to foster a collaborative team environment. You believe in the importance of being ‚Äî and staying ‚Äî authentic, honest, positive, and kind. You are a good interlocutor with clear and concise communication. You are able to manage multiple projects, have an analytical mind, pay keen attention to detail, and love to get your hands dirty. You are cognizant, tolerant, and welcoming of vulnerabilities and cultural differences.

About the Role
Position: Full-time / Employee
Location: Remote-first
Benefits: Health Insurance, work-from-anywhere stipend, annual wellness & learning credits, annual all-expenses-paid company retreat in a gorgeous destination & other benefits

As a Senior Paid Search Specialist, User Experience, you'll steer search strategy, centralize processes, and own growth tools, data, and reporting infrastructure supporting mobile and web search acquisition strategies across diverse regions on paid search channels.
Reporting to the Growth Director, User Experience, you'll lead an outcome-driven approach to app and web marketing, ensuring our paid acquisition efforts on search platforms are top-notch. With a high bar for quality, you'll emphasize attention to detail and employ experimentation frameworks to set up and optimize campaigns effectively. Support to regional counterparts will be provided through sharing best practices, learnings, and mentorship, fostering a culture of shared learning.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Developing and executing mobile app and web acquisition campaigns across various search marketing channels.
  • Continuously supporting regions in testing and experimenting on acquisition campaigns to drive cost-effective user growth, meeting KPIs such as CAC, ROAS, CPS, CPP, LTV, AOV, and payback periods.
  • Owning the data and reporting infrastructure, analyzing user acquisition and engagement data to inform strategy, and being the go-to resource for data-related queries.
  • Collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering, and brand teams to identify levers for improvement and opportunities to enhance ROI.
  • Conducting market and competitor research to identify innovation opportunities supporting growth targets.
  • Staying up-to-date with industry trends, especially in travel, and best practices in mobile app acquisition.
    • ,

    Must-haves:

  • 7+ years of experience managing mobile app acquisition campaigns at scale in performance-driven, competitive verticals, with deep MarTech/MarOps experience.
  • Deep hands-on expertise in Search channels (Google Search, Display, Video, Discovery, Performance Max, etc.).
  • Strong analytical skills and MarTech expertise across various analytics and MMP tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Looker, AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.).
  • Experience in the digital advertising and mobile space, managing $MM annual ad budgets and maximizing ROI across channel mixes.
  • Fluency in English with impeccable verbal and written communication skills.
  • Superior internal and external communication and cross-functional stakeholder management skills.
  • Good time management with an eye for perfection and a strong operational background.
    • ,

    Good to have:

  • Prior experience in the tech, travel, or telecommunications industry.
  • Ad platform and analytical platform certifications.
  • Working knowledge of other search platforms like Bing, Naver, etc. is a plus.
  • Knowledge of eSIM and GSMA-related technologies and services.

    We sincerely thank all applicants in advance for submitting their interest in this opportunity with Airalo.

title: Loan Processor
description:
Come help us change residential real estate investing for the better!

Backflip is a venture-backed real estate FinTech company that supports entrepreneurs to acquire and renovate single family homes, thereby reinvigorating the housing supply and their local communities. The company offers purpose-built technology and capital products to source, analyze and finance residential real estate investments. Backflip is an all-in-one platform providing entrepreneurs with the technology, data, and financing strategies that allows them to scale their businesses.

Backflip is seeking a Loan Processor to execute the lending process from term sheet through final review completion. Backflip originates real estate investment loans (not consumer loans). As an early addition to this team, this individual will play a critical role in ensuring Backflip has a best-in-class processing operation that is borrower-friendly, detail oriented, operationally efficient, organized and designed to scale. They will also play a key role in ensuring Backflip‚Äôs Culture continues to be enlivened in the operation.  

This is a rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor (~60 person team) working directly with executives in a fast-paced and well-capitalized startup (Series A).

All Backflip positions are remote (US based). Like the people we serve, we believe being free to create wherever you‚Äôre most inspired is one of life‚Äôs greatest joys. It‚Äôs better for individuals, for the community, and for fostering great work to emerge. With our work-from-anywhere approach, Backflip brings together a diverse team of individuals, with passions for innovation, art, coding, AI, data, finance, film, real estate, the environment, learning and teaching. Together, we're moving fast.

Come help us change residential real estate investing for the better!

All Backflip positions are remote (US based). Like the people we serve, we believe being free to create wherever you‚Äôre most inspired is one of life‚Äôs greatest joys. It‚Äôs better for individuals, for the community, and for fostering great work to emerge. With our work-from-anywhere approach, Backflip brings together a diverse team of individuals, with passions for innovation, art, coding, AI, data, finance, film, real estate, the environment, learning and teaching. Together, we're moving fast.

*The Compensation figure above includes base salary + variable, and is based on a variety of factors including prior experience. In addition to a competitive market salary, Backflip employees receive equity stock options, 100% paid health care, a 401K + company match, among other industry-leading benefits.

This candidate will champion Backflip‚Äôs culture & Core Values:

  • Raise the standard of what is possible
  • Embrace being the novice to become the master
  • Work only with those who want the best for us
  • Communicate quickly, naturally and with radical candor
  • Test new things to invent and challenge the status quo
  • Today, nay now!

    • Primary Responsibilities

  • Process mortgage loan originations for residential investment properties in compliance with Backflip‚Äôs Credit Policy
  • Manage third parties to collect and verify documents + complete pre-closing requirements (title companies, appraisers, etc.)
  • Ensure an exceptional Member Experience by providing proactive communication on the status of their loan and timely responses to questions during loan processing
  • Communicate effectively across the teams involved in the funnel (sales, underwriting, closing, post-closing)
  • Review and analyze documents against Backflip‚Äôs Credit Policy; flag and mitigate discrepancies
  • Help Backflip‚Äôs Capital Markets team clear conditions and sell loans to third party investors
  • Contribute to the further implementations of standard operating procedures designed to scale operations in harmony with other departments
  • Enliven the company culture to ensure we deliver on our mission to the members and our peers
  • Other duties as assigned, including cross-departmental projects and initiatives

    • This role will evolve as the company grows; there will be various tasks that fall outside of the responsibilities above.

    Qualifications - Role Specific

  • 3+ years of experience in mortgage loan processing, including coordinating with 3rd parties (title companies, appraisers, etc.)
  • 1+ year of remote work experience in a customer facing role
  • Prior closing experience is a plus
  • Experience with short-term bridge loans or construction loans is a plus
  • Prior experience in a customer facing role and ability to offer an elevated customer experience
  • Interest in real estate investing and excited about understanding our member‚Äôs investment journey
  • Prior work at a high-growth start-up is a plus
  • Experience with real estate renovations and project management is a plus
  • General understanding of basic real estate investment concepts (or demonstrated desire to learn); comfortable performing basic math calculations
  • Exemplary computer skills - demonstrated ability and desire to learn new technologies (we use Slack + Notion + Google Workspace + Front + HubSpot + more)
  • Basic spreadsheet skills (Excel; Google Sheets)

    • People That Thrive at Backflip Have‚Ä¶

  • A desire to learn and grow with the company; propensity to ‚Äúthink like an owner‚Äù
  • An execution-oriented ‚Äúone-team‚Äù mindset with motivation and scrappiness to achieve objectives
  • The ability to multi-task with exceptional time management, prioritization and attention to detail
  • An entrepreneurial mindset and a passion for technology and innovation
  • The ability to work effectively in a small, relatively unstructured office environment (we work remotely)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with appropriate urgency to various audiences
  • Strong self-motivation, are coachable and highly collaborative; they take ownership of tasks and pride in work product; details matter
  • High integrity; are dependable, accountable, humble and respectful
    • All Backflip positions are Remote. Like the people we serve, we believe being free to create wherever you‚Äôre most inspired is one of life‚Äôs greatest joys. It‚Äôs better for individuals, for the community, and for fostering great work to emerge. With our work-from-anywhere approach, Backflip brings together a diverse team of individuals, with passions for innovation, art, coding, AI, data, finance, film, real estate, the environment, learning and teaching. Together, we're moving fast.

    Backflip is an equal opportunity employer. We know that building a world-class organization is not possible without an intentional focus on recruiting, empowering, promoting and rewarding the best and brightest people of all backgrounds. Backflip focuses on hiring individuals that align with its Core Values (listed above), and consistently display a high ethical standard, both personally and professionally.


    üëá Disclosures:
    This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship
